awd_titl_txt: Hurricane and Climate Change in Chania, Greece; June 9-14, 2015
awd_abstract_narration:
The 5th International Summit on Hurricanes and Climate Change will take place June 9-14, 2015 in Chania, Crete, Greece with organizing support provided by Aegean Conferences. The purpose of this summit is to bring together an international assemblage of leading academics and researchers on various sides of the debate to discuss new research and express findings about climate changes and future climate scenarios and their implications regarding regional and global hurricane (tropical cyclone) activity. The goals are to address what research is needed to advance the science of the hurricane climate and to provide a venue for encouraging a lively, spirited, and sustained exchange of ideas. Specific topics that will be addressed include surface wind fields, storm surge, seasonal prediction, remote sensing, interannual variability, paleotempestology, lightning, decadal variability, intensification, extra-tropical transition, air-sea exchange, and landfall probability.

The broader impacts will be a better understanding of the future hurricane threat to the U.S. and elsewhere as well as to allow early career participants to have international exposure of their research and network with each other as well as with leading international scientists.

por.por_cntn:
Collins and Walsh received a book contract (Springer) - the research presented at the Summit can be disseminated to a wider audience.  Submissions from paleo-tempestology and sub-fields of meteorology/climatology.  Early and advanced career participants submitted including funded recipients.  Muller,  unable to attend due to immigration issues, submitted a chapter with Collins who presented.

Collins/Murnane had discussions with Emanuel/ Holland to focus the discussions at the 2017 summit on risk assessment and to include a broader perspective including social science.

12 early career recipients - offered funding. Funds distributed evenly between the two programs which provided supported. Some recipients from under-represented groups.

Trouet, awardee, networked at the Summit. WHILE AT THE SUMMIT, she, Collins and Welford submitted a paleotempestology grant application to RPI.

Three months latert, post-Summit feedback was sought from the early career recipients. They would not have been able to participate without the NSF funded opportunity provided. The Summit goals were met.   

... a great career opportunity .... I was able to .... talk to many scientists .. I would not have been able to prior to the Summit. I now ...have a professional relationship with these scientists and... future collaborations are possible because of the Summit.

Thank you ....for the funding. It did make my attendance possible!!

Abby Jaye

This summit clearly helped building my international visibility.... I have been working for a couple of years in the US, I don't have a lot of contact in Europe .... This summit allowed me to talk with several european scientists ...[e.g.] LP. Caron and E. Scoccimarro. 

I could also get career advice from some scientists [e.g.]  Chauvin. 

I also could talk with scientists who use completely different, but very interesting technics for studying TC activity such as Valerie Trouet. 

Anne Sophie. 

I have so many positive experience gained form he conference. As an early career scientist, this is great opportunity to expose my research to the field and to expand my academic network. I also got the chance to collaborate with two other scientists about new research ideas. 

Hui Li

The summit allowed a very unique opportunity to network and really talk one-on-one with others interested in my thesis work.... those with varying backgrounds and who work in different parts of the world. Larger conferences allow this as well, but the size and specific focus of the summit particularly allowed myself to gain an initial rapport that otherwise would not be possible...

Randall J. Hergert 

....The unique thing about the summit is all the informal time that exists to network and talk science.  At a typical science meeting everyone goes their separate ways after the meeting is over, this is not the case at the summit. ...

Kevin Reed

As a result of the summit, Mark, Jennifer, and I started the collaboration that resulted in the proposal we submitted to RPI. It was a great networking opportunity for me: I met very many researchers in a field that I am new to.  Summit definitely helped me receive international visibility in this community.
